Problem:

If the transformation \\(g(\\phi)\\) is applied to the potential \\(\\phi\\) at a point \\((x_0, y_0)\\) and allowed to propagate naturally without further intervention, will \\(\\phi(x, y)\\) at any other point in the domain remain governed solely by the Laplace equation?
Explanation: Appling \\(g(\\phi)\\) at \\((x_0, y_0)\\) modifies the potential at that point, which implies adding a non-harmonic function \\(\\sin(x + y)\\) to \\(\\phi\\). This change violates the harmonic condition locally and can affect the potential at other points differently compared to an unaffected scenario.
